content.question: Which of the following was true of the first Great Awakening?

choices.label: It primarily affected church congregations in towns and cities.
Cotton Mather was one of its most famous preachers.
It was denounced by Jonathan Edwards.
It was primarily a southern phenomenon.
It resulted in divisions within both the Congregational and Presbyterian churches.

content.answer: It resulted in divisions within both the Congregational and Presbyterian churches.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify a historical concept, development, or process.
